snippet.title: Making a Game You Play... WITH A CRANK??? [Playdate Console]
snippet.description:
I made a game for the #playdate, a small handheld game console created by Panic Inc. with a crank sticking out of the side you can use as an input for your games. This is how I made Rocket Bytes for Playdate!

-=-=-=-=-= LINKS =-=-=-=-=-
The game:  https://possiblyaxolotl.itch.io/rocketbytes
Playdate: https://play.date

Stock footage from: https://www.pexels.com/

-=-=-=-=-= SOCIALS =-=-=-=-=-
Clips Channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCWi10IZ0Ba81dcvy6G35yrQ
Discord: https://discord.gg/zK4J8p4
Twitter: https://www.twitter.com/possiblyaxolotl
Itch.io: https://possiblyaxolotl.itch.io/

-=-=-=-=-= ABOUT ME =-=-=-=-=-
I am a Canadian game developer who loves to make weird videogames with unique ideas behind them and try new things out. I love old tech, computers, programming, and making 2D & 3D art (so basically the average nerd). I like to do anything I find fun so if you like that you'll probably like my weird youtube channel.

-=-=-=-=-= MUSIC USED =-=-=-=-=-
Playdate Theme - Cabel Sasser: https://songwhip.com/cabelsasserandsimonpanrucker/playdate-theme
.temp - Graham Kartna: https://grahamkartna.bandcamp.com/album/temp
An Obsession With Kit - Graham Kartna: https://grahamkartna.bandcamp.com/album/an-obsession-with-kit-ep
Various songs from the YouTube audio library

#playdate #gamedev #possiblyaxolotl
